intro: Caraguata mosquerae, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and red berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in disturbed habitats. Due to its toxic properties, it is not typically cultivated for agricultural purposes.
